string.text: An anomaly of unknown nature. On contact inflicts injuries similar to the effects of a strong acid. Forms three types of artifacts: Slime, Slug, and Mica.

One of the first anomalies ever recorded - an unstable gravitational field inflicting shock damage to anyone within its radius. Remains active for a week on average. The amount of damage inflicted changes during its lifetime, ranging from minor bruises, through serious wounds, to instant death. Easy to spot in daylight. Accompanied by air fluctuation above the anomaly, dancing leaves and distinctive crimson-colored stains on the ground. Picked up by all types of detectors, the Springboard can also be revealed by throwing objects into it. Forms three types of artifacts: Jellyfish, Stone Flower and Night Star.

An anomalous formation, roughly 10 meters in diameter, accumulating large quantities of static electricity. When triggered, the anomaly bursts out in dozens of miniature lightnings, causing electric shock nearly always lethal to all living beings. Recognizable by the bluish fog hovering above it in daylight. At nighttime, the Electra can be revealed using any type of detector or by throwing metal objects into the anomaly. Forms three types of artifacts: Sparkler, Flash and Moonlight.

One of the Zone's examples of mutated vegetation. Reacts to rapidly approaching living beings by discharging a cloud of projectiles severely injuring uncovered or lightly protected skin upon contact. Does not react to slowly moving targets. Forms three types of artifacts (possibly its seeds): Spiker, Crystal Spiker and Urchin.

An anomaly of presumably gravitational nature. When triggered, the tremendous power of the Graviconcentrate drags everything within the radius of 10-15 meters towards center. Victims drawn into the core have no chance of survival: their bodies are quickly constricted into a tight lump, only to be blown up in a powerful discharge of energy a moment later. The anomaly remains stationary throughout its lifetime (a week on average). Easily recognizable in daylight by the air fluctuation above, dancing leaves, fragments of dismembered corpses lying around and a distinctive dark stain in the center. Highly dangerous at night since it can be revealed only by means of a detector or by throwing metal objects into it. Forms three types of artifacts: Wrencher, Gravi and Goldfish.

A harmless anomaly, temporarily negating normal gravity. Manifests itself as an area - usually several meters in diameter - where Earth's gravitational pull is greatly reduced. Forms the Cobweb artifact.

The anomaly snatches its victims up in the air and spins them at a breakneck speed. The exact nature of the Meatgrinder remains unknown. The anomaly can be recognized by a light whirlwind of dust above and by body fragments scattered in the vicinity. Victims caught on its outer rim - far enough from the maximum effect zone at the center - can escape the Meatgrinder with relatively minor injuries. Forms three types of artifacts: Stone Blood, Meatball and Soul.
An area of increased radiation - over 50 mR/h. Staying in a radiation zone for longer periods of time is strongly discouraged.

A true miracle of an anomaly: an area several meters in diameter where the time flow is significantly slower than usual. Appears to have no negative effect on human health. However, the Time Machine can be very difficult to get out of. Interestingly, removing Mama's Beads - an artifact usually found in the center of the anomaly - causes the Time Machine to disappear.

While inactive, the anomaly manifests itself as a barely visible cloud of hot air. When triggered by an object or a living being it instantly heats up to lethal temperatures approaching 1500K. At nighttime, it can be revealed by powerful detectors or by throwing metal objects into the trigger area. Forms three types of artifacts: Sprays, Fireball and Crystal.

An artifact formed in the Witches' Jelly anomaly. A translucent, jelly-like object, known to almost instantly nourish the body with nutrients, drive out radiation and stop bleeding. At the same time, however, it makes the user extremely susceptible to electric, chemical and thermal injury. High value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific - mainly medical - organizations.

An artifact formed in the Witches' Jelly anomaly. A translucent, gelatinous object, known to gradually nourish the body with nutrients, drive out radiation and improve blood coagulability. At the same time, however, it makes the user extremely susceptible to electric, chemical and thermal injury. Low value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific - mainly medical - organizations.

An artifact formed in the Witches' Jelly anomaly. A translucent, gelatinous object known to nourish the body with nutrients, drive out radiation and improve blood coagulability. At the same time, however, it makes the user extremely susceptible to electric, chemical and thermal injury. Medium value. The artifact if of primary interest to scientific - mainly medical - organizations.

An artifact formed in the Meatgrinder anomaly. A deformed, reddish object made up of compressed, oddly twisted, polymerized scraps of plants, soil and bones. A popular superstition among stalkers is that the strength of people perished in the anomaly is contained in the artifact. Carrying Stone Blood on your belt slightly speeds up the healing process, though in result your flesh softens up and becomes temporarily more susceptible to injury. In addition, healing requires ample nutrients, lack of which may quickly cause exhaustion. Radioactive. Quite common, hence not very valuable. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific - primarily medical - organizations and various cult members.

An artifact formed in the Scorcher anomaly. A large, glowing, reddish crystal. Stalkers claim that the artifact instantly stops any type of bleeding, at the cost of depleting the user's organism, causing extreme fatigue and hunger. The artifact also provides full immunity from fire, though at the same time it makes the user increasingly susceptible to chemically active substances. Very valuable in view of its scarcity. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations.

An artifact formed in the Springboard anomaly. A beautiful object with a shiny surface sprinkled with yellow-red inclusions. Oddly shaped, composed of tightly-compressed scraps of plants, soil and anything that happened to be within the striking range of the anomaly. The artifact generates a protective field around the user, reducing damage caused by small arms. Radioactive. Medium value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Scorcher anomaly. A tear-shaped object with a glossy, cracked surface. Stalkers claim that carrying the artifact helps to stop bleeding, though it also depletes the user's organism, causing extreme fatigue and hunger. Additionally, the artifact provides partial resistance to fire, at the cost of increased susceptibility to chemically active substances. Low value. The artifact is of primary interest to collectors and jewelers.

An artifact of unknown origin. A small, shiny object with a ribbed surface. Said to fortify the user, suppressing fatigue and hunger, and protecting the body from electric discharges. Very valuable. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations.

An artifact of unknown origin. Two disks held together by a slimy substance. Reduces damage caused by bullets as well as bites and injuries inflicted in melee combat. Additionally, reduces damage caused by gravitational anomalies. High value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations.

An extremely rare artifact of unknown origin, resembling an oddly coiled spiral strewn with pearly droplets. Nourishes the user, completely suppressing the feeling of hunger. Anyone carrying the artifact can do without food or drink for an infinite period of time. The only known side-effect is the increased susceptibility to radiation. The artifact is highly valued by all sorts of organizations and individuals.

A rare artifact of unknown origin. A fine glassy film with uncommon refractive properties. Protects the user from chemical agents and increases the overall stamina. Radioactive. High value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, jewelers and show-business celebrities.

An artifact of unknown origin. Two disks held together by a slimy substance. Significantly reduces the damage caused by bullets as well as bites and injuries inflicted in melee combat. Additionally, the artifact reduces damage caused by gravitational anomalies. Radioactive. The Spring accumulates radiation in the body, at the same time increasing the user's susceptibility to it. Very valuable. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations.

An artifact formed in the Electra anomaly. A translucent, amorphous object with light beams pulsating under the surface, occasionally generating miniature lightning sparks. Carrying Flash on your belt improves your stamina and provides partial resistance to electricity. At the same time, though, the artifact makes the user more susceptible to radiation. Average value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Electra anomaly. A translucent, amorphous object with a glowing core, generating miniature lightning sparks. Carrying the Moonlight on your belt makes you tireless and virtually invulnerable to electric damage. At the same time, though, the artifact makes the user much more susceptible to radiation. High value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Electra anomaly. A translucent, amorphous object generating miniature lightning sparks. The Sparkler slightly improves the user's stamina and provides some resistance to electricity. At the same time, though, the artifact makes the user more susceptible to radiation. Low value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Scorcher anomaly. A translucent, reddish, globe-shaped object. Stalkers claim that carrying the artifact helps to stop bleeding, though at the same time it depletes the user's organism, causing extreme fatigue and hunger. While the artifact provides some resistance to fire, it also raises susceptibility to chemically active substances. Average value. The artifact is of primary interest to collectors and jewelers.

A rare artifact of unknown origin. A globe the size of an orange. Carrying it grants the user a high degree of resistance to fire and electricity. As a side-effect, the artifact slightly increases susceptibility to radiation. High value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific, mainly medical, organizations.

An artifact formed in the Graviconcentrate anomaly. A beautiful object with a shiny surface. Oddly twisted, composed of highly compressed scraps of plants, soil and anything that happened to be within the striking range of the anomaly at the moment of discharge. Carrying the artifact on your belt greatly reduces the damage caused by bites or inflicted in melee combat. Highly radioactive. Very valuable in view of its scarcity. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Graviconcentrate anomaly. Oddly twisted, composed of highly-compressed scraps of plants, soil and anything that happened to be within the striking range of the anomaly. Carrying the artifact on your belt greatly reduces the damage caused by bites or inflicted in melee combat. Radioactive. Average value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Springboard anomaly. Oddly twisted, composed of highly-compressed scraps of plants, soil and anything that happened to be within the striking range of the anomaly. Forms a weak protective field around the user reducing damage inflicted by small arms. Radioactive. Quite common, hence not very valuable. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations.

An artifact formed in the Meatgrinder anomaly. A deformed, yellowish object composed of compressed, oddly twisted, polymerized scraps of plants, soil and bones. A popular superstition among stalkers is that the strength of people perished in the anomaly is contained in the artifact. Carrying the Meatball on your belt greatly speeds up healing, though in result the human flesh softens up and becomes temporarily more susceptible to injury. Additionally, the healing process requires ample nutrients, lack of which may quickly cause exhaustion. Radioactive. Average value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific - primarily medical - organizations, and various cult members.

An artifact formed in the Springboard anomaly. A beautiful object with a shiny surface and colorful phosphorescent inclusions. At night produces a greenish sphere of light about 1-2 meters in diameter. Oddly shaped, composed of highly-compressed scraps of plants, soil and anything that happened to be within the striking range of the anomaly. The artifact generates a protective field around the user reducing damage inflicted by small arms. Highly radioactive. Highly valuable in view of its scarcity. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations and the military.

An artifact formed in the Burning Fluff anomaly. A dull, cracked gem. Carrying the Crystal Spiker on your belt quickly purges your body of radiation. Known side-effects include a strong feeling of hunger and increased likelihood of ear- and mouth-bleeding. The artifact greatly improves resistance to chemical burns and radiation, but also increases susceptibility to fire and electricity. Average value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Burning Fluff anomaly. A grayish sphere covered in small thorns. Carrying the Urchin on your belt will almost instantly clean your body of radiation. Known side effects include the feeling of rapacious hunger, as well as ear and mouth bleeding, plus occasional minor wounds over the entire body. The artifact makes the user almost completely invulnerable to chemical burns and radiation, though it also greatly increases susceptibility to fire and electricity. High value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations, collectors and jewelers.

An artifact formed in the Burning Fluff anomaly, resembling a rusty ball with spikes. Carrying the Spiker on your belt slowly yet efficiently cleans your body of radiation. Known side effects include a strong feeling of hunger and likelihood of occasional ear and mouth bleeding. The artifact greatly improves resistance to chemical burns and radiation, but also increases susceptibility to fire and electricity. Low value. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations and collectors.

An artifact formed in the Meatgrinder anomaly. A yellow-reddish, shiny object composed of highly-compressed and oddly twisted polymerized scraps of plants, soil and bones. A popular superstition among stalkers is that the strength of people perished in the anomaly is contained in the artifact. When placed on your belt, the artifact completely restores the user's health within seconds, though the body temporarily becomes highly susceptible to all sorts of injury. Additionally, the healing process requires a great amount of nutrients, lack of which may quickly lead to exhaustion. Highly radioactive. Very valuable in view of its scarcity. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific - mainly medical - organizations and various cult members.

An artifact formed in the Graviconcentrate anomaly. Oddly twisted, composed of highly-compressed scraps of plants, soil and anything that happened to be within the striking range of the anomaly. Carrying the artifact on your belt greatly reduces the damage caused by bites or inflicted in melee combat. Radioactive. Quite common, hence not very valuable. The artifact is of primary interest to scientific organizations.

A strange, heavily contaminated area. Should you wander deeper into it, you will see a shallow lake, crammed shore-to-shore with abandoned equipment and other debris. You can also check out the abandoned Institute and the factory, though the military have been hanging around there quite a lot recently.

The Duty faction have set up camp on the plain's edge and they always welcome stalkers in need of rest. A desert oasis of sorts - a place completely devoid of anomalies and mutants. Be sure to check out the 100 Rads bar in the vaults - it's a meeting point for stalkers from all over the Zone. The bar is run by the local trader, so if you're interested in selling or buying wares apart from the local gossip - that's the place to go to. North of the bar is the military base, with the Dump to the South.

Always gloomy, always misty and always rainy. Stalkers venturing into the Dark Valley are likely to find valuable artifacts, instant death, or both. A place frequented by some of the most experienced old-timers, though you may also stumble upon some common bandits. There's supposed to be an underground lab around there somewhere, so it might be worth to look for a hidden entrance along the way. No one has returned from there alive though and no one can tell for sure just what nasty surprises await you there.

Think of it as the Zone's antechamber - it's a good place for rookies to get their head around. You'll find a trader in the vaults at the back of the village, next to the army outpost. Don't miss the chance to talk to him. You'd be advised to steer clear of the outpost itself, however. You don't want the soldiers to catch a sight of you - most of them shoot first and don't bother asking questions later. Yet, as always, there are some who can be bribed as long as the top brass is looking the other way. Attacking the soldiers is not recommended, unless they pose a direct threat.

A vast machinery graveyard. Right after the first accident whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped there. Mostly ruins of old buildings infested with mutants. Much like the outskirts of the Zone, the place swarms with rookie stalkers, with an occasional bandit loitering around, always on the lookout for freebies. Some artifacts to be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort. You'll be better off elsewhere. Going North, you will get to the Wild Area, West lays the entrance to the Dark Valley, with the road to the Agroprom R&D Institute to the East.

A deserted army base next to a dilapidated hamlet and a small marsh. The village is an eerie place literally swarming with mutants - the bloodsuckers alone are legion. Stalkers do their best to keep away from it, even if it means going extra kilometers around it. The anarchists from the Freedom faction have settled down in the army base. The road connecting the base to the Zone is guarded by the Brain Burner, which blocks the way to Pripyat and the Chernobyl NPP.

This used to be a town built for engineers working at the Chernobyl NPP. Quite a big place once, it is a ghost town now with mutants and zombies as the only residents. There seems to be no way to get in there: the Brain Burner is blocking the way.

A dreadful place. Easy to vanish without a trace there, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far. Whoever gets close to the Brain Burner immediately goes insane, turns into a zombie and starts stalking the Zone restlessly. A human shell is all thatís left. No-one has ever returned with a sound mind.

The Wild Area used to be the site of a rather large manufacturing plant, currently in ruins. Many stalkers met their death there: the place is swarming with all sorts of monsters. The beasts are literally streaming over there from the entire Zone. It is said that something of great importance is hidden at this site, so there are always plenty of daredevils willing to try their luck.
The site of the world-famous nuclear power plant. This is the heart of the Zone. If you believe the legends, this is also the site of the Monolith - a mysterious thing capable of granting any wish.

The legendary lake in the sector of the same name dried up a long ago, leaving a shallow swamp in its place. The place is morbid and sodden with death. Great dangers await any adventurous soul foolish enough to get near it. Anyone who dares to go too far goes insane. Zombie drones are rambling around the whole sector, waiting for new victims. If you walk around the lake and past the zombies, youíll end up at the scientists' camp, where the eggheads brought there by choppers are doing some research. You can have a chat with them; they buy artifacts and could even send you on a mission.

The contaminated zone was aglow with the brightest of lights, almost unbearable to the human eye. You could virtually see the clouds in the sky turning into vapor. After a moment of dead silence there came rattling thunder, and then the earth shook. People fell to the ground, screwing up their eyes and covering their ears. Those who could still stand ran for their lives. It looked as though all the nuclear fuel buried under the Sarcophagus had suddenly exploded. The next day the army cordoned off the new Zone. The satellites helped to establish that the epicenter of the explosion was not actually in the vicinity of the NPP reactors, but about half a kilometer away. It is believed that the personnel of the station died at once, though many people still remained within the cordoned area. The rescue operation soon proved a pointless endeavor, as all the people and machinery sent deep into the area would die or malfunction immediately. A little while after the disaster, the Zone diameter hopped out by a few more kilometers. Most of the government troops guarding the border line and the research teams stationed there perished instantly. Panic stricken, people took to flight. The residents of nearby towns and villages were hastily evacuated. An enormous danger is looming over the world and we can only guess what its full impact may be.

Two years have passed since the disaster in the contaminated zone around Chernobyl NPP. Skyrocketing deathtoll, countless people missing, dead cattle, decaying buildings, maimed forestsÖ Until this day scientists have no explanation as to what exactly happened in Chernobyl. Meanwhile, some inconceivable anomalies were discovered in the area, and the Zone keeps expanding. Rare expeditions encounter mutated species of animals exhibiting unbelievable abilities.

Following in the tracks of those foolhardy loners who call themselves the stalkers, research expeditions are once again embarking on an in-depth study of the Zone. However, the perimeter guarded by the army has other, dangerous inhabitants now - from common poachers to the worst bandit scum. Most of the stalkers roam the Zone in search of anomalies and the so-called artifacts for which they gain quite a profit.

The army, including special forces headed by paramilitary stalker detachments, launched a massive raid deep into the Zone. Their objective was to break through to the Chernobyl NPP and wipe out the cause of anomalous fields or at least obtain first-hand information on the current state of affairs. This endeavor, involving over a thousand people and heavy machinery, was a complete failure. Isolated groups of survivors were forced to settle within the Zone with slender hopes of rescue.
